column5: It's still dry.....fire ban to continue.
No worries... I have a trip coming up, and in normal fashion it appears that my week is bringing lots and lots of rain to the Red Lake area. You're welcome.
Don't count on plenty rain,there long range forecasts always shows plenty rain,but it usually doesn't happen,time will tell I'm leaving thursday and it's showing rain rain rain next week.
I'm will be arriving in Perrault Falls friday night and it can rain all it wants as long as the lightning stays away! Later, Jay

No worries... I have a trip coming up, and in normal fashion it appears that my week is bringing lots and lots of rain to the Red Lake area.I am sure most folks up there (and here in the Midwest) would like to see rain for a week..Do you still fish with Bill/Loiuse/Coppen..Loon Haunt?? Good hosts/nice people and we had many great trips with them. Just sorry they moved on from our favorite lake.
Just an FYI that a fire ban has gone into effect in pretty much the entire province of Ontario. No campfires. Hot. And very dry. We could use some rain for sure. -FT
Looks like Dryden area is getting some rain !
Looks like its Socked in pretty good today over by Dryden ! Fire ban ?

Fire burning near my cabin in Grayling Mi, only about 3000 acres so far but it had I75 closed for a while. People across the state reporting hey can smell it and being told no, those are fires in Canada you're smelling. Need rain across the whole continent.

We got to the Gouin on the 31st. Stayed at Air Tamarac. We had to cut our trip short. The camp has been completely evacuated because of ongoing forest fires. There’s been a haze in the air since this morning and you can smell the smoke in the air. Anyone going to the Gouin should call first. Don’t know how long this will last.
Propane burners still allowed for shore lunch, but please be careful everyone. The White River fire made for a smoky day on the lake and an eerie sunset on Kabi two days ago…
The smoke from this fire was quite visible yesterday around my area . Hope all will be well with your place. PjShorthorn

Looking at this map from NASA it looks like large swaths of Northern Quebec are on fire.https://[email protected],48.0,8zIm not an expert by any means but it looks like the more heavily logged areas are the ones with the active fires. For the Gouin fisherman, looks like there is a large fire west of the reservoir.

Pretty smoky in the North Georgia mountains today from the CA wildfires. I had to drive across the mountain for work and it was like driving on a foggy morning. Yuck! Hoping for some good rain to put the fires out and get the firefighters back home safe and sound.
